text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Greek Cypriot press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- (Right wing) Disy party expects clarifications from Yiannakis Matsis, its party leader who resigned his post on Wednesday. Vice chairman Nicos Anastassiades will probably be the only candidate in party elections scheduled for May.
- Four basketball players are detained on suspicion of attacking a policeman.
- The drugs squad are in the dock over a sting operation in which an Egyptian was jailed for 12 years. The appeals court ordered his release.
- Church ownership of the Hellenic Mining Company is under the spotlight as archbishop is set to sell his stake in Vassiliko Cement
- The (Glafcos) Clerides government has led the Cyprus issue to a dead end with its inconsistent policies, says communist Akel party leader Demetris Christofias.
- Confrontational atmosphere in Disy is toned down. Matsis is determined not to seek re-election to the post of party leader.
- Alleged Turkish spy was working on the construction site of the Paphos airbase, while man now in custody was roaming army camps, using his family as a cover, to film installations.
- Tough rally starts for the succession of Yiannakis Matsis in Disy.
